sources.title: I walk around Moscow
sources.description:
On his way to the homeland of a deceased comrade, a young assembler from a distant taiga stopped in Moscow for one day to meet with the editor of the Yunost magazine, in which he published his first story. Volodya spent this day with new friends, Muscovites Kolya and Sasha, met a girl Lena and invited her to his construction site...

IMDb: 7,8

Year of production: 1963

Director: Daneliya Georgiy
Screenwriter: Gennady Shpalikov
Composer: Andrey Petrov
Operator: Yusov Vadim
Production designer: Myagkov Alexander

Cast: Lyubov Sokolova, Irina Miroshnichenko, Arkady Smirnov, Rolan Bykov, Galina Polskikh, Nikita Mikhalkov, Evgeny Steblov, Lev Durov, Vladimir Basov, Alexey Loktev

- Prize "for the high quality of photography and excellent camera movement in accordance with the plot of the film" at the IV International Technical Film Competition UNIATEC in Milan (Italy) (1964)
- Award for the best camera work Yusov V.I. at the I VKF in Leningrad (1964)
- Award for the best camera work Yusov V.I. at the XV IFF of working people of Czechoslovakia (Czechoslovakia) (1964)
- Diploma of participation at the Meeting-review in Prade (France) (1964)
- Mention at the XVII IFF in Cannes (France)
